Text: Great upload, thank you Rocktookmehere.

This is great, the interview between Mike Wallace and Rod Sterling is really interesting.  The first episode is also incredible, I love how in true 1950 style (tv being the iPad of the day) networks basically had to beg and plead for advertising dollars.  It took a few days to download but was def worth it.
Does anybody have any idea how many DVDs I'll need to burn these? (4.7 GB) I'm guessing around 7?

turns out I'm getting 3 eps. per disk. thats gonna be about 50 disks... Does anybody have an easier way? I guess I could hook my laptop up to the TV, but I'd rather not considering the amount of shit I already have on my laptop.

As for the files themselves, it's great quality. Audio is good, and the images are about as clear as you can get for a show made in the 50s. Thx rock.
Thanks for the upload! This is awesome!!! You can get 11-12 episodes on 1 disc if you use DVD Flick, which you can download for free.  Google it.

The subtitles are missing from the following parts:
Season 1
S03E14 Five Characters in Search of an Exit
S03E31 The Trade-Ins
S03E37 The Changing of the Guard
S05E21 Spur of the Moment

For the other parts you can find them in the web. For season 1 you'll find nothing. The subtitles of the last 4 films are also in the web, but they dont match the film in no way. (I have compared the dialogs.) They are wrong labeld. Maybe a copy paste error.

I can't thank you enough for saying that. My only reason for being here is to try to figure out which episode it is that "The Box" is based upon. Been trying to figure out for a while.

Many thanks!!

It says at the end of the movie The Box that the movie is based off of a short story by Richard Matheson.  I do not know if the episode was also based on the short story, but I do not think the short story and the episode are one in the same.  Great Job on the upload.
I looked it up.....the episode is based off of the same short story.  So to give credit where it is rightfully due, both the episode and the movie were based on a short story named Button, Button.
